title: cmd/gc: typechecking confused by inlining builtin embedded types.
body:
by **leterip**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Make a couple packaged with the files described by this paste:
http://play.golang.org/p/fnXV1s8VSM

What is the expected output?
go build succeeds

What do you see instead?
# test
test/test.go:3: errtest.eÂ·2.error undefined (cannot refer to unexported field or method
errtest.error)
test/test.go:3: unknown errtest.Error field 'errtest.error' in struct literal

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
os x and linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go1.1.1 and tip (71b918d9078e)

Please provide any additional information below.
Sorry the example isn't shorter. I have been unable to determine what the minimal
example is. The errors change in surprising ways, and sometimes it compiles fine. I
believe the embedded error field has something to do with it.
